answers.answer: You may have a pinched nerve in your neck esp  if you have had muscle tension, neck and back aches, and etc.   I would go see a doc or chiropractor.

The most common cause is nerve compression in the cervical area. Spinal stenosis is one possible etiology.A potential problem is that if compression lasts long enough the nerve may atrophy.An MRI of the cervical spine should provide a definitive diagnosis.A x-ray is both innappropriate and meaningless.See an M.D. - not a chirpopractor.Treatment is generally intermittant axial traction and range-of-motion exercises.There is always the remote possibility of a growth, so an MRI is the best way to go.

Hi! The numbness could be due to nerve compression. This is possible at various levels. It could be due to compression of the spinal nerves at the cervical spine level or, ulnar or median nerve at the elbow or wrist level. Hypothyroidism, diabetes, tumors and infections of the ulnar and spinal nerves and rheumatism can all cause numbness of little and ring finger. Please consult a neurologist. Take care!

question: My hand has numb for 3 days. What could cause this and should I see my Dr.
title: Left hand numb
